results.title: Lena the glassblower: Sweden
results.creator_credit: Peter Rowe, Fred Harris, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The story of Lena, a 17-year-old girl who decides to become a glassblower against the wishes of her parents, who want her to take up tertiary education. As well as dealing positively with this conflict, the film shows many aspects of the craft of glassblowing - in particular, that carried out at the Orrefors establishment in Sweden. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Rowe, Fred Harris, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films

results.title: Ming-Oi the magician (Hong Kong)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Focuses on a sixteen-year-old Hong Kong girl, a magician’s apprentice. who works hard to perfect the illusions of Chinese magic and juggling.

results.title: Julia the gourdcarver: Peru
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman and Sunrise Films Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Four thousand years ago in the high mountains of the Andes, the Inca Indians began carving gourds to record their legends and history. Today Julia Sanabria, 11 years old, continues the ancient craft taught by her uncle. She carves her own life story on a gourd and takes it to the market town of Huancayo. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Gopal's golden pendant: India
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Looks at a family in Jaipur, India, whose members are master craftsmen in the art of enamelling gold and silver. In particular, the film focuses on a ten-year-old boy who has been learning the craft since he was six. Suitable for lower secondary level.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.

results.title: Kurtis: Hollywood stuntboy
results.creator_credit: Paul Quigley, Peter Rowe and Sunrise Films Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Kurtis Sanders is a 12 year old stuntman. The film shows stunts Kurtis and his family perform for a television special illustrating stuntwork. It also shows original footage of old westerns in which Kurtis’s grandfather was a stuntman.

results.title: Yohannes the silversmith (Ethiopia)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gilbert, Paul Quigley and Sunrise Film's Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
This film highlights the customs and traditions of villagers in Ethiopia, as well as evidence of cultural change. It focuses on a twelve-year-old boy who decides to learn the craft of silver smithing to earn an income to help pay for his tertiary education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Gilbert, Paul Quigley and Sunrise Film’s Ltd
results.description:

results.title: Slima the dhowmaker: Tanzania
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
A Tanzanian teenager is apprenticed to a dhow-builder and learns skills unchanged for two thousand years. The film shows the building of a boat and the ceremony surrounding its launching.

results.title: Yoshiko the Papermaker (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Yoshiko Fujimoto, thirteen, lives in the tiny mountain village of Obara-Mura which retains its seven hundred year old traditions for unique handmade paper panels. Yoshiko learns this ancient art from a local master.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
